thread.title: Royals Alex Gordon struck by own foul ball during batting practice
thread.title_full: Royals Alex Gordon struck by own foul ball during batting practice

title: Royals Alex Gordon struck by own foul ball during batting practice
text:
Tweet 
TORONTO, ON - OCTOBER 19: Alex Gordon #4 of the Kansas City Royals hits a single in the second inning against the Toronto Blue Jays during game three of the American League Championship Series at Rogers Centre on October 19, 2015 in Toronto, Canada. (Photo by Tom Szczerbowski/Getty Images) KANSAS CITY, Mo. - 
Kansas City Royals left fielder Alex Gordon suffered a bloody nose during off-day batting practice when he was struck by a ball off his own bat on Thursday. 
Gordon hit a ball that struck the top of the batting cage and it ricocheted directly back at him and hit him in the nose. He was momentarily stunned and bleeding before leaving the field for treatment. 
The situation won't prevent Gordon from being in the lineup for Friday's Game 6 of the American League Championship Series against the Toronto Blue Jays. Kansas City has a 3-2 lead in the best-of-seven series. 
Copyright 2015, Schurz Communications
